titleStmt.title: Atlas maritimus, or The sea-atlas being a book of maritime cards. Describing the sea-coasts, capes, headlands, sands, shoals, rocks and dangers. The bays, roads, harbors, rivers and ports, in most of the known parts of the world, collected from the latest and best discoveries that have been made by divers able and experienced navigators.
titleStmt.author: Robijn, Jacobus, d. ca. 1710.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Jacob Robyn, in the New Bridge street, in the Stuureman,

notesStmt.note: Entirely engraved except for four pages of text following engraved title page.
Dedication signed and dated: Jacobus Robyn, At Amsterdam, the 25th day of July, 1682.
The "2" in the imprint date has failed to print in copy catalogued.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

place.placeName: the New Bridge street, in the Stuureman
